title: The Neurobiology of Threat Impacts Your Relationships, Ann and Sue Update You on the Latest (173)
description: Ann and Sue blend their own personal experiences and knowledge of neuroscience to help improve your relationships and integrate healing change within the body. Follow along as they apply all we know about the fear system and the unconscious defense, and cover the misconceptions about how the amygdala is often perceived as the "fear center" of the body.
itunes:subtitle: Learn about relational neurobiology to help you keep your cool
itunes:summary: Ann and Sue blend their own personal experiences and knowledge of neuroscience to help improve your relationships and integrate healing and change within the body. Follow along as they apply the latest about the fear system and nonconscious defense, and they correct the common misconception that the amygdala is the "fear center" of the body. They also bring in research published the same month this episode was recorded around understanding fearful memories being stored in the sensory cortex.  If science talk makes your eye's cross don't worry - they make it easy to understand and apply in real life.  Find more at www.therapistuncensored.com/episodes.
itunes:author: Ann Kelley PhD & Sue Marriott LCSW
